Definitely look at people's tutorials. There are a few really good youtube tutorials put together by some of the folks here, and that certainly worked for me. You'll want to export your model from Blender in one of the exportable formats (I've had good luck with Collada/DAE, but OBJ has worked well too when for some reason the DAE file wouldn't import).

For most parts, you can do the simple thing in Unity with part-tools like the tutorials explain. With engines, you'll have to add a thrustTransform that points the right way. If you want the engine to gimbal, you'll need to make the engine bell a separate mesh and make it a child of the thrustTransform object. If you want to have a discardable fairing, like the stock engines, it will also need to be a separate mesh, and get tagged with "Icon_Hidden" so it doesn't appear in the VAB's menus. All of these details are in some of the links from that mega-links-post.
Thanks! By discardable fairings, do you mean the bits around an engine above a decoupler?
Yep, the shroud that sticks to the decoupler.

Oh, one more thing-- when you're ready to start importing it into Unity... go to their archive downloads, and get version 4.2.2. Apparently any newer version than that, and you won't be able to animate engine glow.
